reviews.review_msg: Full of contempt, dismissive and totally allergic to original ideas. Not only she does not have a clue about what she is talking, she does not have a clue about what you (as a student) are saying. Fails to understand most of the philosophical concepts; very limited philosophical insight.

This prof can teach- she just assumes you are as smart as her.. Remind her you're not! Yes, I agree she doesn't put you at ease initally, but she's very nice, very intelligent, witty, just try to show her some respect. (don't fall asleep and then wake up and ask her what she was talking about)
I'm a third year philosophy student who had to take one of the lower requirements.  She was condescending and original thought was unwelcome.
great prof! do your work and you'll be fine!
So great and so useful - is a credit to the philosophy department and all first year students
This guy is a hack. Worst instructor in the department, and very self-involved!
Tough course. Brilliant guy - great sense of humour.Hard to grasp material, but very interesting lectures.
funny guy.. makes boring course interesting
Terrible professor do not recommend. Avoid her if you can.
I had high hopes and was disappointed

Jennifer is easily one of the best professors! I told her I was extremely nervous about philosophy and she was consistently there for support, making it one of the most enjoyable classes! I highly recommend taking a class with her for the experience alone, especially smaller classes so you can get to know what an amazing person she is first hand!

Nothing to complain about, except for the fact that she doesn't have regular office hours. However, she replies promptly to emails and will answer your questions directly in class. Oh, and she sticks to EARLY modern philosophy even though the course description was modern philosophy. Not a biggie, though.

She is a really nice instructor.  However, she is disorganized, does not respond quickly to emails, and is a slow marker.  But the class discussions are enjoyable and thought provoking.  If you are patient then I reccomend this class.

Jenn has good notes, assigns good readings, and a good way of teaching the course.  However she does get side-tracked a lot by questions, but that's most likely due to the first year students.  I would def. take another class with her, just not with the amount of repetition i found between philosophy 100 and 151 at SFU - honestly, 2/3rds the same!

Took history of phil. II with him. Would never take a class with this prof again. Said "um" over 60 times in the first lecture. Monotone voice. In a class that had the potential to be interesting, I was really surprised at the quality. We went over divine foreknowledge/fatalism (though the concepts of fw/d were never explained well) way too much.

This was the worst philosophy class I have ever taken. He gave absolutely zero feedback on the final paper aside from the grade, which was far from helpful. Marking on the midterms was inconsistent and he refused to explain what was missing if the mark was low. He was arrogant and unhelpful.
knows what he is talking about, cares about his students and communicates with them well, exceptional professor overall.
